page.title: 16WOODLAND IN THE AREA
page.content: Although there are no large woods in this area there are many small stands of trees.In the valley the trees tend to be deciduous whereas on the hills conifers predominate.Many of the stands of trees in the area are now approaching maturity.These were planted about 40 tears ago to provide shelter for steadings in the valley or for the animals on the hills.Trees also follow the river ,these tend to be Alder.Ingram village is situated in a wooded area.These woods are deciduous and contain sycamore ,horse-chestnuts,ash and some oak.These are also mature woods.As some of the older conifers are felled they are being replaced by new areas of trees.
